title: Georgia May Foote claims she questioned her own life after ending her 'abusive relationship
text:
Former Coronation Street star Georgia May Foote admits she was left depressed, anxious and questioning the point of her own life following an acrimonious split from ex-boyfriend George Alsford.

Addressing fans in am Instagram video post during Mental Health Awareness week, which runs until Saturday October 12, the actress revealed she was forced to seek professional help after ending an ‘abusive’ relationship with model George and moving back to her native Bury, Lancashire.

‘In 2018 I came home from London, I came out of a really awful breakup, through an abusive relationship, and I came out feeling very lowly of myself,’ she explained.

Upset: Coronation Street star Georgia May Foote admits she was left depressed, anxious and questioning the point of her own life following an acrimonious split from ex-boyfriend George Alsford

‘I got very depressed; I was questioning everything about myself, about life, about my career, about my friends and my family.

'I felt very lonely. I was having panic attacks all the time and I just thought I genuinely can’t get through this anymore – it was hurting me inside.’

After speaking to a local doctor, Georgia, 28, underwent a course of therapy with the Bury branch of free NHS service Healthy Minds, and despite her initial scepticism towards counselling she credits them with helping to save her life.

Opening up: Addressing fans in am Instagram video post during Mental Health Awareness week, which runs until Saturday October 12, the actress revealed she was forced to seek professional help

Old times: But Georgia broke things off with George in January 2018 after a series or arguments during their 18-month relationship

‘I am telling you now, I probably wouldn’t be here without that service, alongside my friends and my family, and being open and talking about it,’ she told followers.

‘I just want people to know out there that there is help, whether it’s through your GP, taking medication – there’s nothing wrong with taking medication – whether it’s through opening up to just one person in your family, one of your friends, you need to do it.

‘And it’s scary, feeling that way is terrifying. I have days where I sit here and think, “Oh my gosh, this is the worst, I feel awful. I get anxious, I start shaking, I feel sick. But it’s always OK in the end and I always come through it. It’s just about finding the balance.’

New romance: The actress has been involved in a new relationship with rapper Kris Evans since November 2018

It's understood that Georgia broke things off with George in January 2018 after a series or arguments during their 18-month relationship.

A source told The Sun: 'They tried to make it work but called it quits after a series of arguments. Georgia has been left devastated, as she really thought he was The One. She's been struggling.'

Before dating George she was in a relationship with Strictly Come Dancing partner Giovanni Pernice, whom she dated following the end of her relationship with Corrie co-star Sean Ward in 2015.

The actress has been involved in a new relationship with rapper Kris Evans since November 2018.
